alert.note: Alert for Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 4:03PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kittitas County through 445 PM PDT... At 403 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Easton, or 10 miles southeast of Snoqualmie Pass, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Easton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest
